item.title: Kristina add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, Nothing is going to get better. It's not." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Read the best books first, or you may not have a chance to read them at all." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Any fool can make a rule And any fool will mind it." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I did not wish to live what was not life, living is so dear; nor did I wish to practise resignation, unless it was quite necessary. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life, to live so sturdily and Spartan-like as to put to rout all that was not life, to cut a broad swath and shave close, to drive life into a corner, and reduce it to its lowest terms." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "If you care about what you do and work hard at it, there isn't anything you can't do if you want to." -- Jim Henson

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "I must take issue with the term 'a mere child,' for it has been my invariable experience that the company of a mere child is infinitely preferable to that of a mere adult." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Phil Collins
item.description: "In learning you will teach, and in teaching you will learn." -- Phil Collins

item.title: Kristina add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Kristina add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kristina add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kristina add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kristina add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kristina add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain
